channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Netflix’s $5.8 billion breakup fee for Warner among largest ever
item.description: Inc.’s $72 billion acquisition of Inc. includes one of the biggest breakup fees of all time — a $5.8 billion penalty that Netflix has agreed to pay it...

item.title: Quant who said passive era is ‘worse than Marxism’ doubles down
item.description: Inigo Fraser Jenkins calls it a “dystopian symbiosis”: a feedback loop between index funds and platform giants like Apple, Microsoft and Nvidia.

item.title: A Walk Along the Fault Lines
item.description: Remembering longtime National Review senior editor David Pryce-Jones.

item.title: ‘Its own research shows they encourage addiction’: Highest court in Mass. hears case about Instagram, Facebook effect on kids
item.description: The lawsuit claims Meta designed features to make them addictive and that its actions affected hundreds of thousands of Massachusetts teenagers.

item.title: A Thanksgiving dealmaking sprint helped Netflix win Warner Bros.
item.description: While most Americans were feasting, Netflix executives and advisers hunkered down to finalize a binding offer and a $59 billion bridge loan.

item.title: Washington Times Weekly: Jobs down, shopping up, diving headfirst into the holiday season

item.title: A West Coast Mamdani
item.description: Like her East Coast counterpart, Seattle’s mayor-elect fails to understand how wealth and scarcity work.

item.title: The Terrorism Confusion in the Caribbean
item.description: The president of the United States has no unilateral authority to use military force in the absence of a legitimate armed conflict.

item.title: Boston’s Museum of Fine Arts Goes Big and Goes Winslow Homer in a Splendid Show
item.description: The museum displays all of its nearly 50 Homer watercolors, saluting Homer, Boston’s native son, and more than a century of collecting.

item.title: The U.S.-Israel Alliance Pays for Itself
item.description: From real-time intelligence to combat-tested systems, Israel provides strategic benefits that exceed the cost of U.S. aid many times over.

item.title: Today In Republicans Being Useless: House GOPers Surrender On Obamacare Fight
item.description: By every measure, the GOP is more useless than that raccoon that broke into an ABC store, got drunk, and passed out on the bathroom floor.

item.title: Normal Americans Are The Ones Who Pay The Price For Biden’s Disastrous Immigration Policies
item.description: 'This is a horrific situation, but one we’ve seen play out across Colorado and across the United States,' said Colorado DA George Brauchler.

item.description: In its special message, inaccurate wording disguises the USCCB’s self-interested opposition to the deportation of illegals.

item.description: American teenagers have a fractured relationship with the federal government, one that may never be healed.
